User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.133 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: http://download.mozilla.org/?product=firefox-4.0rc1&os=win&lang=en-US

If you uncheck the "Always show the tab bar" checkbox under Options --> Tabs, Firefox does not display the title of the open tab anywhere in the chrome if only one tab is open.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click "Firefox" --> "Options" --> "Tabs"
2. Uncheck "Always show the tab bar"
3. Close all tabs except one, tab bar disappears
Actual Results:  
Where's the title of the tab? Nowhere!

Expected Results:  
Display the tite of the tab beside the Firefox logo either using the native application title property or by some other means
